alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 14 at 3:42PM AKST until January 15 at 9:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...LONG DURATION SNOW EVENT FOR THIS WEEKEND... .As a system positions itself across the northern gulf, moisture is being steered into the Panhandle, with widespread precipitation enveloping the north and central areas. Through the day warmer temperatures have penetrated inland, with many observation sites rising a few degrees, with this warming trend continuing into Monday afternoon. Expect snow ratios to drop as snow becomes wetter and heavier. As the front moves southeast Monday afternoon it will bring accumulating snowfall to the southern Panhandle. For the north, expecting accumulating snowfall to end sometime Monday night, with clearing moving north to south through the day Tuesday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations up to 25 inches. * WHERE...Glacier Bay and City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 9 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and is discouraged unless it is an emergency. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...As temperatures continue to rise, snow will continue to become wetter and heavier Sunday into Monday.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water with you in case of an emergency. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
